page.title: 17TOPOGRAPHY
page.content: This area is situated in the Weald of Kent just outside the town of Royal Tunbridge Wells. The main feature is a ridge running through the middle of the area - the village of Langton Green is situated on this ridge. To the south the land falls away to a valley, but to the north-west the ridge opens out to a small plateau at Fordcombe before falling away to the Medway valley. It is a very uneven stretch of land with lots of streams and valleys scattered around the area. The two steepest hills are probably Fordcombe Hill and Barrow Lane. There are some fairly rocky areas, most notable being the sandstone outcrop at High Rocks.Most of the land is on a clay base mixed with sandstone and some chalk. It is not very good for growing plants or crops. This ground is called the Hasting Beds.
